parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests.

The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: ConnectionStringPrefix
parameters.description:
The prefix of the internal endpoint.

When you create any type of endpoint, an internal endpoint is automatically created for the endpoint. This parameter specifies the prefix of the internal endpoint.

parameters.name: DBInstanceEndpointDescription
parameters.description: The user-defined description of the endpoint.

parameters.name: DBInstanceEndpointType
parameters.description:
The endpoint type. Valid values:

*   Primary: read/write endpoint of the instance
*   Readonly: read-only endpoint of the instance

parameters.name: DBInstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. You can call the DescribeDBInstances operation to query the instance ID.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description:
The port number of the internal endpoint. You can specify the port number for the internal endpoint.

Valid values: 3000 to 5999.

parameters.name: PrivateIpAddress
parameters.description: The IP address of the internal endpoint.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The resource group ID. You can call the DescribeDBInstanceAttribute operation to obtain the ID of the resource group.

parameters.name: VSwitchId
parameters.description: The vSwitch ID of the internal endpoint.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The VPC ID of the internal endpoint.
